meanings.sent1: In Mongolia, people use soums to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for soums when I visited Mongolia.
meanings.sent3: The soums in my pocket jingled as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a handful of soums.
meanings.sent5: The colorful soums sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'soum', referring to the currency of Uzbekistan.
meanings.sent1: Do you have any soums left from your trip to Uzbekistan?
meanings.sent2: The market in Uzbekistan only accepts soums for payment.
meanings.sent3: He found a forgotten stash of soums in his suitcase.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang out like a bag full of soums.
meanings.sent5: The soums from Uzbekistan had intricate designs.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'soum', referring to a unit of currency in various countries.
meanings.sent1: Different countries have different values for their soums.
meanings.sent2: She collected soums from all around the world.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, along with a handful of soums.
meanings.sent4: His words were like soums, each one carrying weight.
meanings.sent5: The soums from different countries varied in size and color.
